about_the_game:
Ad Victoriam is an indie game with a simple premise: "what would it have felt like to be on an ancient battlefield and observe the clash of armies unfolding?"

Using parallel computing, Ad Victoriam can simulate tens of thousands of soldiers all displayed in real time! Soldiers will maneuver together and fight in groups - at least that is, until the heat of battle causes them to break ranks and flee. We've put great emphasis on realism and immersion - soldiers neither mob as mindless zombies nor fight in perfect unison as permanent unit blocks.

The year is 59 BC. You, Julius Caesar, have become a Consul. It is time to seek fortune in conquest. New lands await, and perhaps one day Rome itself! To victory! Ad victoriam!

content_descriptors.notes: Depicts war / violent battles, with dead warriors collapsing to the ground.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5 / AMD Ryzen 3 (4 cores)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 / AMD Radeon RX 570
  • DirectX: Version 12
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i7 / AMD Ryzen 5 (6 cores)
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 / AMD Radeon RX 6600 / Intel Arc A750
  • DirectX: Version 12

short_description: Ad Victoriam lets you experience large scale immersive battles and lead Caesar's legions to victory in a groundbreaking simulator! You can start up custom battles or play a full strategy game as you conquer Gaul and establish the Roman Empire!
